title: Business & Finance
text:
Major U.S. stock indexes suffered their sharpest one-day losses since October, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq both retreating 2.6% and the Dow falling 2%.

---

The Fed kept its easy-money policies in place, saying that business activity has softened with the resurgence of Covid-19 cases.

---

Apple finished 2020 with its most profitable quarter ever and for the first time exceeded $100 billion in quarterly revenue.

---

Facebook posted record revenue and profit for the fourth quarter while warning of challenges including growing friction with Apple.

---

Boeing reported its biggest-ever annual loss and took a big financial hit on its newest jetliner, signs that the pandemic is compounding the company's problems.

---

Ant Group is planning to turn itself into a financial holding company overseen by China's central bank , responding to regulatory pressure.

---

Tesla posted its first full- year profit and laid out plans for a sharp increase in production over coming years.

---

Exxon is preparing to make changes to its board and adopt other measures as it faces pressure from a pair of activist investors.
